title: Asesor Patrimonial
description:
Somos socios comerciales de Prudential, la compañía aseguradora de vida número 1° en Estados Unidos y la 3° a nivel mundial, con más de 145 años en el mercado, nos hemos consolidado a nivel internacional como una de las marcas en expansión con mayor éxito y tu mejor opción para respaldar tu desarrollo profesional.

Si estás buscando un nuevo reto, te interesa el sector asegurador, cuentas con las siguientes características y estás ansioso por desarrollarte hasta alcanzar tu máximo potencial respaldado por la mejor compañía no dudes en postularte.

Habilidades y aptitudes:
Facilidad y gusto por las ventas face to face.
Personalidad y confianza.
Gusto por el trato con la gente.
Excelente comunicación.
Espíritu emprendedor.
Ambición.
Autoestima elevada.
Agilidad mental.
Tolerancia a la frustración.
Trabajo en equipo.
Sociable.
Buscar crear cultura financiera en México.

Requisitos:
Perfil y experiencia en ventas o áreas comerciales.
Certificado de bachillerato o cédula profesional en físico obligatorio.
Experiencia en industria financiera o comercial intangibles.
Interés por ingresos mayores a los $50,000 mensuales por comisiones.

Ofrecemos:
Capacitación pagada y certificada.
Compensación variable: comisiones y bonos más altos del mercado.
Crecimiento a corto plazo.
Balance entre vida personal y laboral.
La oportunidad de emprender tu propio negocio con el respaldo de una gran compañía.

* Si estás buscando un puesto con un horario fijo y sueldo fijo favor de no postularse.

Esperamos tu postulación, nos dará mucho gusto conocer tu trayectoria profesional.

Tipo de puesto: Tiempo completo

Salario: A partir de $50,000.00 al mes

Prestaciones:

  • Horarios flexibles
  • Programa de referidos
  • Trabajo desde casa

Tipos de compensaciones:

  • Bono anual
  • Bono de productividad
  • Bono trimestral

Educación:

  • Bachillerato terminado (Obligatorio)

Lugar de trabajo: Remote

title: Asesor de estrategias de inversión
description:
Asesor de estrategias de inversión

Importante empresa financiera, busca tu talento, donde apoyarás en la toma de decisiones importantes. Trabajamos en estrecha colaboración con nuestros clientes para comprender sus problemas y crear soluciones de vanguardia para resolverlos.

Qué ofrecemos

title: PM BA Core Banking Trader exp Murex, Kondor, Calypso Remoto
description:
¿Por qué nosotros?

  • Solidez financiera, estabilidad laboral, crecimiento profesional y multiculturalidad; somos una empresa con presencia a nivel mundial desde Latam USA e india nos especializamos en soluciones de software con socios como Mambu, Oracle, Microsoft o AZURE; buscamos un Analista Funcional, Business Analyst, Project Manager o líder de implementación de core banking en el Módulo de tesorería y en especial de mercado de capitales en esquema remoto.

Lo que puedes hacer en esta oportunidad:

  • Liderar la implementación de soluciones con diferentes Vendors y proponer nuevas integraciones.
  • Colaborar con equipos multiculturales, crear nuevas conexiones y aprendizajes
  • Crecer personal y profesionalmente, aprovechando todos los programas de formación, integración, movilidad y en especial balance de vida

¿Qué requieres saber?

  • 4 a 5 años de experiencia mínima como: Business Analyst, BA, Analista de Negocio, IT Consultant, Project Manager, PM, Lider de proyecto, líder funcional, analista de implementación, analista funcional, consultor funcional, Scrum Master, PO, Product Owner, Business Owner, delivery manager, Service manager con experiencia deseable en Fintech, Banca, Mercados de Capitales, Inversiones, Forex, etc.
  • Ingles intermedio
  • Conocimiento en negocio (experiencia en mercado de capitales (roles asociados como trader, analistas de mercado de capitales), conocimientos en renta fija, derivados (Swaps, Opciones Futuros), PnL (pérdidas y ganancias), Money Market, Fx (Spot):parte del mercado de money market compra y venta de monedas en corto plazo
  • Gestión y valoración de producto, gestión de riesgos financieros, cumplimiento operativo, implementación de proyectos de software de mercados de capitales del sector financiero, entender las herramientas, gestión de clientes, análisis y seguimiento de procesos, levantamiento de requerimientos, reuniones con clientes, definición y construcción de producto.
  • Conocimiento en alguno de los siguientes software: de tesorería: Finastra Kondor (treasury trading market), Murex, Calypso, Ncino, Temenos, Mambu, Silverlake, Oracle Flexcube, Simcorp, Aladdin, Summit,
  • Gestión, análisis y levantamiento de requerimientos de negocio, Análisis funcional y técnico de requerimientos. Documentación de estos.
  • Herramientas de modelado: Enterprise Architect, MS VISIO, Modelado de datos, entre otras.
  • Experiencia en gestión y seguimiento de equipos de desarrollo locales, remotos y tercerizados.
  • Seguimiento a incidentes en la entrega de los servicios a usuario final y equipos de desarrollo.

Nuestra propuesta:

  • Ingreso: 65,000 a 70,000 pesos libres, prestciones de Ley y Superiores
  • Horario: de lunes a viernes de 9:00 a 19:00 pm
  • Zona de trabajo: Home office (Uso horario Colombia)

Tipo de puesto: Tiempo completo

Salario: $60,000.00 - $70,000.00 al mes

Horario:

  • Turno de 8 horas

Prestaciones:

  • Caja de ahorro
  • Seguro de gastos médicos
  • Vales de despensa

Experiencia:

  • Implementación Core Banking Tesorería, Capital, Forex: 4 años (Deseable)
  • Conocimiento vendor Finastra, Calypso, Murex, Mambu, etc.: 4 años (Deseable)

Lugar de trabajo: Remote

title: Administrador de Proyectos Web
description:
Espora Estudio (esporaestudio.com)

Somos una empresa de desarrollo de software. Trabajamos desarrollando sistemas para comercio electrónico y sistemas a la medida.

Descripción

Buscamos un Administrador de Proyectos de Software experimentado y detallista para dirigir el desarrollo y la implementación de soluciones de software innovadoras. Este papel requiere una mezcla de habilidades técnicas, interpersonales y de liderazgo para guiar a equipos de desarrollo, facilitar la colaboración y asegurar la entrega oportuna de proyectos.

Responsabilidades

1. Planificar y definir el alcance del proyecto, incluyendo la determinación de los objetivos del proyecto y las métricas de éxito.

2. Gestionar todo el ciclo de vida del proyecto de desarrollo de software, desde la concepción hasta la implementación y la entrega.

3. Coordinar y colaborar con las partes interesadas internas y externas para asegurar que se cumplan las expectativas del proyecto.

4. Supervisar y administrar los recursos del equipo, incluyendo la asignación de tareas y la supervisión del progreso.

5. Identificar y gestionar los riesgos del proyecto y proponer planes de mitigación.

6. Medir el desempeño del proyecto y realizar informes de seguimiento.

7. Implementar y promover las mejores prácticas de gestión de proyectos de software dentro del equipo.

Conocimientos

· Experiencia demostrable en la gestión de proyectos Agile y Scrum.

· Excelentes habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita.

· Fuertes habilidades de liderazgo y capacidad para motivar a un equipo.

· El administrador del proyecto debe ser capaz de comunicarse de manera efectiva con los clientes para proporcionar actualizaciones regulares, especialmente cuando los proyectos no están yendo según lo planeado. Esto incluye la capacidad para explicar conceptos técnicos de una manera fácil de entender para el cliente.

· El administrador del proyecto debe tener la habilidad para gestionar y resolver conflictos de manera constructiva y pacífica, buscando soluciones que beneficien a todas las partes.

Tipo de puesto: Tiempo completo

Salario: $15,000.00 - $25,000.00 al mes

Horario:

  • Lunes a viernes
  • Turno de 8 horas

Prestaciones:

  • Días de maternidad superiores a los de la ley
  • Días por enfermedad
  • Opción a contrato indefinido
  • Trabajo desde casa
  • Vacaciones adicionales o permisos con goce de sueldo

Educación:

  • Licenciatura terminada (Obligatorio)

Experiencia:

  • Agile: 2 años (Obligatorio)
  • Scrum: 2 años (Obligatorio)
  • Líder de Proyectos: 2 años (Obligatorio)

Lugar de trabajo: Remote

Fecha límite para postularse: 30/07/2023
Fecha de inicio prevista: 01/08/2023

title: Virtual Assistant - English Speaking
description:
Work from Home - Virtual Assistant (English Speaking)
at Evernest

In Evernest, our core focus is to develop people personally and professionally. If your goal is to grow and become the best version of yourself this is the perfect opportunity for you!

Our story began in 2008 with thirty rental houses and three people. Today, we manage over 13,000 properties and have over 350 teammates all over the world. Our goal is to manage 25,000 properties by the end of 2024 and provide the best property management experience to our customers.

Join us to achieve our goals as an international team member and learn from the best in the industry! Previous experience in property management is not required, we make it our priority to teach you everything you need to know about managing properties, teams, and our business.

*Important Note - When applying for this position, please upload your resume in English.

COMPETENCIES & REQUIREMENTS
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Proficient use of technologies.
  • 1 - 3 years of ascertainable professional experience.
  • Detailed oriented.
  • Customer Service
  • Desire to work as part of a team.
  • Collaboration and effective communication.

Minimum requirements to work with us:
  • Fast Internet: minimum download speed of 40 Mbps.
  • Working Computer (Preferably laptop).
  • 2 Monitor Screens.
  • Webcam.
  • Headset.
  • Quiet workspace.
  • Ninth or 10th-generation Intel i5 or i7 processor, at least 8GB of RAM (preferably 16GB if an option), and 256GB of SSD storage
  • Ability to relocate within 30 minutes in case of power or internet outage

Compensation Details:

Starting salary range of 7 USD to 9 USD per hour, and the opportunity to move up and grow! Although this is a remote position which means you will always be working from home, we require full-time availability. Our schedule is Monday to Friday from 8 am to 5 pm CST and we do not offer any part-time positions.

OUR CULTURE:

Want to find out if you are a good fit for our team?
We attribute our success to an incredible team and a thriving company culture. Our company culture influences our daily activities. Having competent job qualifications is, of course, necessary, but embracing the Evernest core values is what matters first.
1. Win Together - You are passionate about the company’s growth and the way you and your team perform will help us achieve our goals. “Individually, we can only achieve so much; as a team, everyone can meet, and exceed our goals”.

2. Do the Right Thing - You understand that we will always be honest with each other, our residents, and our owners. We operate a truth-based company with elevated levels of accountability, regardless of how it affects us individually or as a company.

3. Own the Outcome - You understand that consistent daily activities have the power to produce remarkable results over time. We will push ourselves to never be stagnant and never accept the status quo. We are determined to revolutionize this industry.

4. Embrace the Grind - You are committed to growth in your market and position no matter what it takes or how long. Beginning with just thirty houses to now more than 13,000, it has taken an extreme amount of hustle and perseverance to grow Evernest, and we expect nothing less from you!

5. Grow Daily - You commit yourself to daily disciplines, we call these: Hustle Habits, both inside and outside the office. The positive habits we create in our life impact our company and our clients. It's not an easy business, and there's no substitute for discipline if you want to be successful.

title: Copywriter Jr
description:
Funciones:

El Copywriter se dedicará a crear excelente contenido original. Trabajará en estrecha colaboración con el departamento de Marketing para comprender mejor las expectativas del proyecto, producir contenido con las necesidades del cliente en México, participar en el proceso de lluvia de ideas y realizar investigaciones para desarrollar o apoyar la redacción. También debe estar preparado para ayudar con otros procesos creativos, como la selección de elementos visuales.

Responsabilidades:

  • Escribir, revisar, editar y actualizar contenido para sitios web, blogs, materiales de marketing y plataformas similares de la empresa.
  • Muy buenas habilidades en la creación de contenido para Redes Sociales.
  • Asistir al equipo creativo con el diseño de materiales promocionales.
  • Colaborar con los departamentos internos para establecer los objetivos del proyecto, completar tareas e identificar y resolver problemas.
  • Mantener la consistencia en el contenido y asegurar la alineación con el historial y los planes de la marca.

¿Qué necesitas?

  • Inglés intermedio-avanzado.
  • Licenciatura en Marketing Digital, Comunicación o afín.
  • Al menos 2 años de experiencia como Creador de Contenido, Redacción, Edición o similar en medios digitales.
  • Experiencia en la creación de contenido sólido y atractivo.
  • Fuertes habilidades de comunicación escritas y habladas.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

  • Esquema híbrido, reuniones presenciales una vez al mes.
  • Sueldo mensual bruto de $20,000.00
  • Prestaciones de ley y superiores (vales de despensa, apoyo Home Office, SGMM, Seguro de Vida, fondo de ahorro, entre otros).

Tipo de puesto: Tiempo completo, Por tiempo indeterminado

Salario: $20,000.00 al mes

Horario:

  • Lunes a viernes
  • Turno de 8 horas

Prestaciones:

  • Seguro de gastos médicos mayores
  • Seguro de vida
  • Trabajo desde casa
  • Vales de despensa

Pregunta(s) de postulación:

  • ¿Cuantos años de experiencia tienes como Copy?
  • ¿Tienes experiencia en agencia de mkt digital?

Lugar de trabajo: Remote

title: Customer Success Advisor
description:
Who We Are:

HighLevel is an all-in-one, white-label marketing platform for agencies & consultants. Our goal as a business is to create a sustainable, powerful, “all things marketing” operating system that creates limitless opportunities for our customers. With over 20,000 customers, we need people like YOU to help us grow and scale even further in the coming years.


We currently have 300+ employees worldwide, working remotely as well as in our headquarters, which is located in Dallas, Texas.


Our goal as an employer is to maintain a strong company culture, foster creativity and collaboration, and, above all, encourage a healthy work-life balance for our employees wherever they call home! At HighLevel, we require our team members to be on camera for all customer, peer and supervisor interactions. Want to learn more? Check out our website: www.gohighlevel.com.


Who You Are:

As an Advisor your sole responsibility is positioning yourself as the subject matter expert on software business growth through the effective use of technology. The Advisor utilizes their expertise in business process/change management and software technologies by implementing software best practices and ensuring adoption and success with HighLevel software. Including detailed onboarding playbooks and building relationships with customers, business needs, and company.


This role is 100% remote for residents of Mexico.


What You Will Be Doing:

  • Listen and fully understand customer requirements and ‘pain points’ and translate customer requirements into implementation plans.
  • Develop, coordinate, and execute implementation/upgrade/conversion project plans, task schedules, and resource activities to ensure on-time and effective project delivery.
  • Design, create and manage applications, and software integration/migration deployments.
  • Implementation services are delivered within scope or manage any changes in project scope, identify potential issues and collaborate with leadership when needed, to develop contingency plans.
  • Working with other departments and personnel to ensure information on customer needs are communicated.
  • Follow up relentlessly with lagging or non-engaging accounts to ensure they implement HighLevel successfully in their business.
  • Assist in Educational webinars, workshops, and more.
  • Staying up to date with product features and releases.
  • Identifies opportunities to streamline procedures, enhance revenue and improve product efficiency.
  • Updates customer journey playbooks.
  • Demonstrate technical acumen to convert plans into workable solutions.
  • Communicate a passion for customer success with a team player attitude.
  • Monitor, anticipate, and exceed customer adoption and usage metrics (i.e., renewals and net promoter scores).
  • Conduct analysis of approved customer content and create a transition plan or migration plan.
  • Advise customers on best practices, risks, and changes that impact institutional processes and timelines.
  • Responsible for driving consulting milestones and achieving the agreed-upon implementation schedule.
  • Provide guidance to customers to address critical and/or outstanding issues impacting the successful Implementation.
  • Actively lead the consulting engagement throughout the implementation.
  • Drive collaboration between internal functional teams and customers to achieve milestones and deliverables.
  • Handle basic support requests during the implementation phase.
  • Develop a strong rapport with new accounts to ensure they are enthusiastic about HighLevel and set up for long-term success.
  • Always looking for ways to improve our onboarding delivery.
  • Maintain product knowledge and consistent education.
  • Cross-training with other success functions.
  • Other duties may be assigned and/or modified as business needs change


What You'll Bring:

  • Associate degree or equivalent work experience and a minimum of two years of software implementation/consulting experience or technical support.
  • 2-3 years of experience using HighLevel or other similar vertical solutions.
  • Strong skills, tact and diplomacy in dealing with sensitive customer issues, with exceptional follow-through ability and communication skills.
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
  • Knowledge of internal systems preferred (HighLevel, Freshdesk, etc.).
  • Strong understanding and proficiency in software solutions and professional service offerings.
  • 2+ years of customer consulting work experience preferred.
  • 2+ years of marketing experience is a plus!
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • IT technical skills and platform integrations.
  • Experience in managing a diverse group and training each according to company standards.
  • Great communication skills, verbal, written, and presentation capabilities with both customers and leadership.
  • Self-starter, with a strong sense of ownership, assertive follow-through, and a passion for the highest level of customer satisfaction.
  • Ability to handle the ambiguity that arises from time to time in a dynamic and fast-paced collaborative work environment.
  • Strong analytical and organizational skills with superior attention to detail.
  • Ability to produce high-quality documents, SOP’s and customer journey Playbooks.
  • Strong computer literacy, including MS Office Suite, Internet applications, and comfort and ability to advance technically.

8AjIUEoF2S

title: Surgical Acute Account Manager (New Health Care Company) - Albuquerque, NM
description:
Job Description:
Surgical Acute Account Manager (Albuquerque, NM)
3M is establishing two industry-leading companies, creating value through the spin-off of its Health Care business, while 3M will continue to be a global material science leader, focusing our innovation to win in favorable global megatrends and attractive end markets. This new Health Care Company will be a leading global diversified health technology company with:
  • Proven category leadership
  • Exposure to attractive end-markets
  • Innovation mindset driving improved patient outcomes
  • Collaborative customer relationships
  • Deep global regulatory experience
  • Operational excellence and strong cash flow
  • Strong sales growth and profitability with significant recurring sales
We expect the creation of the two companies will be completed by the end of 2023. For now, we will continue to operate as one global company. This role is positioned to drive the success of the "New Health Care Company”.
This position provides an opportunity to transition from other private, public, government or military experience to a 3M career.
The Impact You’ll Make in this Role
As a Surgical Acute Account Manager, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. Here, you will make an impact by:
  • Driving 3M Medical Device Sales revenue by developing and managing relationships with key customer decision-makers including clinical, procurement, and materials management staff
  • Presenting and reinforcing 3M value proposition to differentiate 3M from competitive products
  • Establishing and driving usage protocols to optimize revenue for negative pressure wound therapy and pressure injury products
  • Managing the introduction of new technologies through new product committee process
  • Providing in-services, training, and general guidance to customers on the appropriate and approved use of 3M products and customer facing systems
  • Utilizing salesforce.com to assist in developing a territory plan to prioritize account calls and activities
  • Developing clinical champions to drive key implementation of initiatives into assigned accounts
  • Maintaining sales call data by entering into designated 3M system, completing required corporate and region reports within designated timeframes, and resolving accounting milling, MIA and contract renewal issues
Company Vehicle
This position requires driving a company vehicle, which will require pre-employment and ongoing review of motor vehicle history for candidates who are offered and hired for this position
Your Skills and Expertise
To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher (completed and verified prior to start)
  • Five (5) years of customer facing experience in a private, public, government or military environment
  • Current, valid Driver’s License
Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:
  • Medical device or pharmaceutical sales experience
  • Hospital or operating room sales experience
  • Experience with navigating new product introductions and the value analysis review process
  • Demonstrated track record of success in hospital, pharma, and/or business-to-business sales
Work location: Territory will cover Albuquerque, NM
Travel: May include up to 50% domestic (Percentages of time spent on job duties are an estimate and may vary)
Relocation Assistance: May be authorized
Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).
Certain job positions within 3M require workers to work in the presence of others within certain geographies and/or at third-party locations. As a necessary requirement of this position with 3M, you must be fully vaccinated at least two weeks prior to your start date. As a reminder, fully vaccinated against COVID-19 means a person has received their primary series of COVID-19 vaccines, and, in certain situations, may also include booster doses.
Supporting Your Well-being
3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.
Chat with Max
For assistance with searching through our current job openings or for more information about all things 3M, visit Max, our virtual recruiting
Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M.
Responsibilities of this position include that corporate policies, procedures and security standards are complied with while performing assigned duties.
Our approach to flexibility is called Work Your Way, which puts employees first and drives well-being in ways that enable 3M’s business and performance goals. You have flexibility in where and when work gets done. It all depends on where and when you can do your best work.
Pay & Benefits Overview: https://www.3m.com/3M/en_US/careers-us/working-at-3m/benefits/
3M is an equal opportunity employer. 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.
Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.
3M Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement

Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at 3M are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.

title: Consultor SAP MM Remoto
description:
Consultor SAP MM

Como Consultor SAP MM desempeñarás un papel importante en la implementación de mejoras o nuevas funcionalidades enfocadas en el Proceso de Adquisiciones en SAP para una empresa global.

Requisitos:

  • Inglés Conversacional Avanzado (Indispensable)
  • Licenciatura o Ingeniería en Sistemas o afín concluida
  • A partir de 5 años de experiencia en SAP ERP /S4H/ MM

Conocimientos:

  • Experiencia con ABAP, IDOCS y la tecnología de interfaz común de SAP
  • Familiarizado con conceptos como ALE, EDI, BAPI o IDOC (deseable)
  • SAP Ariba (deseable)
  • Preparación de documentos de especificación funcional, documentos de configuración, escenarios de prueba y guiones de prueba

Rol:

  • Configuraciones S/4H Material Management (MM)
  • Integración con otros módulos de SAP y Sistemas SAP ERP
  • Pruebas unitarias, pruebas de integración durante implementaciones y actualizaciones.
  • Soporte de 3er nivel a los departamentos comerciales en SAP Procurement
  • Participar en reuniones de equipos locales o globales de negocios o TI.

Prestaciones y Beneficios:

  • Contratación 100% en nómina
  • Prestaciones de Ley y Superiores
  • Sueldo de hasta $100,000 brutos
  • Aguinaldo
  • Prima vacacional
  • Fondo de Ahorro
  • Vales de despensa
  • Bono a mitad de año
  • Bono por cumplimiento de metas anual.

Lugar de trabajo:

  • Oficinas ubicadas en Monterrey, Blvd. Antonio L. Rodríguez
  • Modalidad de trabajo remoto

Tipo de puesto: Tiempo completo

Salario: Hasta $100,000.00 al mes

Horario:

  • Lunes a viernes
  • Turno de 8 horas

Prestaciones:

  • Caja de ahorro
  • Opción a contrato indefinido
  • Seguro de gastos médicos
  • Seguro de gastos médicos mayores
  • Seguro de vida

Experiencia:

  • Implementación de SAP MM: 5 años (Obligatorio)
  • SAP S/4HANA: 5 años (Obligatorio)
  • ABAP y IDOCS: 4 años (Deseable)

Idioma:

  • Inglés Avanzado (Obligatorio)

Lugar de trabajo: Remote
